Explain prediction of a single observation
  • Reference

Explain prediction of a single observation

The Table with influence of variables and interactions on the prediction of a given observation.

EIX_waterfall(xgb.model, new_observation, option = "interactions",
  baseline = 0)

Arguments

xgb.model

a xgboost or lightgbm model
new_observation

a new observation
option

if "variables", the plot includes only single variables, if "interactions", then only interactions. Default "interaction".
baseline

a number or a character "Intercept" (for model intercept). The baseline for the plot, where the rectangles should start. Default 0.

Value

an object of the broken class

Details

Function contains code or pieces of code from breakDown code created by Przemysław Biecek and xgboostExplainer code created by David Foster.

Examples

library("EIX")
library("Matrix")
library("data.table")
library("xgboost")

dt_HR <- data.table(HR_data)
sm <- sparse.model.matrix(left ~ . - 1,  data = dt_HR)

param <- list(objective = "binary:logistic", base_score = 0.5, max_depth = 2)
xgb.model <- xgboost(sm, params = param, label = dt_HR[, left] == 1, nrounds = 50, verbose = FALSE)

new_observation <- sm[9,]
wf <- EIX_waterfall(xgb.model, new_observation,  option = "interactions")
wf
#>                                         contribution
#> intercept                                     -1.530
#> time_spend_company                             1.519
#> last_evaluation                                1.485
#> Work_accident                                 -0.736
#> satisfaction_level:time_spend_company          0.406
#> last_evaluation:time_spend_company             0.316
#> number_project:last_evaluation                 0.258
#> satisfaction_level                            -0.238
#> last_evaluation:average_montly_hours           0.227
#> number_project                                -0.224
#> salarylow                                      0.166
#> average_montly_hours:last_evaluation          -0.156
#> last_evaluation:satisfaction_level             0.111
#> average_montly_hours:time_spend_company        0.098
#> time_spend_company:last_evaluation             0.095
#> average_montly_hours:number_project            0.094
#> average_montly_hours                          -0.048
#> satisfaction_level:number_project             -0.003
#> final_prognosis                                1.839
#> baseline:  0 
plot(wf)
